fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12765].
  {panel}

Hi,

it would be a great advantage for us, if we had the possibility to restrict the attachment access in a particular space, for example for a particular user group. That means that although this restricted group have full access to page content (including images and links), but not to the attachment list itself.

Thanks,

Martin
fields.summary: Functionality to grant and remove permission for attachment access

fields.description:
If you have a parent page and a child page and the parent page is restricted, 
then the child page will (correctly) be likewise restricted. But if you MOVE 
the child page somewhere else, it stays restricted even though its new parent
has no restrictions.

I was able to correct the situation by adding and then removing the same 
restriction from the new parent page, which had the effect of clearing out 
the child restrictions as well.

*I cloned this issue because the error still exists in 2.9.0 and the original issue has been marked as closed*
fields.summary: Moving a child page does not update restrictions
Enable user to limit the number of attachments returned by the {attachments} macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12761].
  {panel}

# I find it the currently rendered Template pages with form objects all over the place awful to look at and use.  Consider a long page, with 8 fields spread throughout.  In order to _find_ the fields you have to scroll up and down etc.
# I also find it strange that because the page is rendered, it limits what can be set as a field, for example:
#- macro parameters (this kills Template Fields usage for me)
#- url parameters etc
#- links

In order to support what I am about to suggest, the Template fields would have to be updated to support groupings through a Category value, and to provide a clue as to the fields intended purpose, shown here with a *#* separator char.
h4. Current
{noformat}
||Some field | @fieldname@ |
{noformat}
h4. Proposed
{noformat}
||Some field | @Category1#Field Label text#fieldname@ |
{noformat}

h4. Example form 
{panel:title=Example Form}
h5. Category 1
|| Field Label text | *[FORM ENTRY BOX*|
|| Another Field Label text | *[FORM ENTRY BOX*|
h5. Category 2
|| Field Label text | *[FORM ENTRY BOX*|
|| Another Field Label text | *[FORM ENTRY BOX*|
{panel}

This would then allow pages with complex arrangement of field values to be easily provided without the Junk that appears with dynamically create content.   Also, and most importantly this would allow arbitrary replacement of _any_ text _anywhere_ in the page, solving all related issues about where such values can/cannot be used.
fields.summary: Prompt for page template field values using a simple form rather than a rendered page.
Allow more then one label

fields.description:
A customer has commented about an error in {{service.bat}} on the following doc page, and another customer has agreed:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Start+Confluence+automatically+on+Windows+as+a+Service

Quoted from the comment:
{quote}
in service.bat

"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp -XX:MaxPermSize=128m" --JvmMs 128 --JvmMx 256
echo The service '%SERVICE_NAME%' has been installed.

should be replaced by

"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp;-XX:MaxPermSize=128m" --JvmMs 128 --JvmMx 256
echo The service '%SERVICE_NAME%' has been installed.

otherwise confluence as a service will start but won't work
{quote}

The comments are currently here, but will be removed once this issue is fixed:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Start+Confluence+automatically+on+Windows+as+a+Service

Please investigate --- does {{service.bat}} need to be fixed?

fields.description:
A customer found that when running Confluence behind a firewall, a POP mail request from a space (which won't work because of the firewall) will cause the java process for Confluence to max out, bringing their whole system down.

As it is not possible to check which space that has POP configured, trying to fix a problem caused by such configuration can be very difficult.

In such a situation, it is desirable to have a way to identify whether a POP account has been setup in any spaces and also a way to disable them globally.

A work around that is available at the moment is to [disable mail pooling in Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3ucC] - this will prevent Confluence from checking for new mail automatically, but mail retrieval will still work if a user triggers "Check for new mail" manually.

This can be done by restarting Confluence with the following parameter:
{code}
-Dconfluence.disable.mailpolling=true
{code}
fields.summary: Allow a functionality to disable POP Mail globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12751].
  {panel}

Add ability to list attachment's physical location when searching for attachments.

For example, in case Lucene indexing is broken, thus unable to search for attachments, provide other means to do so.

The SQL query below locates specific attachment by the file name - show searching for a file with the word 'office' in it's title. The result will show the location on your filesystem as well. 
On Linux you can use the {{file}} command to find out the details about the file. {code}file -i <file_name> {code} will print out the MIME type as well.

{code:sql}
select s.spacekey, s.spacename, a.title, a.pageid, a.attachmentid, '(confluence-home)/attachments/' + a.pageid + '/' + a.attachmentid + '/' + a.attversion as filepath
from attachments a
join content c
    on a.pageid = c.contentid
join spaces s
    on c.spaceid = s.spaceid
where a.title like 'office%
{code}
fields.summary: Locate Attachments

fields.description:
The labels shown by setting showLabels=true link to display content with that label from ALL spaces instead of just the space the item is located in

Example:

Using the Contentbylabel macro and the showLabels=true optional parameter, I can display a link to an item (page/blogpost)

e.g Oceans & Coasts  Labels: conservation, tropical-seas-and-coasts, antarctica-and-southern-ocean 

The labels on the Oceans & Coasts page if clicked on here link to eg. https://site-url/label/conservation

But when you go to the Oceans & Coasts page and click on the label link from there you go to e.g. https://site-url/label/spacekey/conservation

The big difference here is the inclusion of the spacekey

When the Contentbylabel macro displays the labels it leaves out the space key. This is the bug I am reporting here.

Either the macro should be fixed to include the spacekey or an additional parameter should be included to inform the macro which link to use (to the space the item is located in (default) or to ALL spaces) (or showLabels=false (default), all or space)
fields.summary: The label link in contentbylabel always goes to the site-wide context

fields.description:
I'm using teh PageTree plugin with the searchBox enabled. 
Entering a search expression in the box causes a search with the entered search expression extended by "ancestorids:999999 AND MySearchExpression"
e.g.
I enter the word "security" to be searched for 
Confluence expands the expression to:
"ancestorIds:393219 AND security"

Wich causes an empty search result.

fields.description:
Currently all the children of ContentFilterMacro carry out all of their search functionality independently. We should pull out the common functionality into ContentFilterMacro, in particular the max results setting.

This would ensure that fixes to bugs like CONF-11850 need not be applied to each macro individually. I took a quick look at the class and it looks like most of the functionality is already present and just hasn't been fully implemented.
fields.summary: ContentFilterMacro should enforce max results for its sub classes

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12739].
  {panel}

Many of our users share their thoughts by editing their wiki pages and signing their additions.

It would be very useful to have specific markup helpers as in wikipedia:

You should sign your comment by
appending four tildes (~~~~)
to the comment so as to add your
user name plus date/time:
: ~~~~
Adding three tildes (~~~) will add
just your user name:
: ~~~
and adding five tildes (~~~~~) gives
the date/time alone:
: ~~~~~

fields.description:
Raised by Sarah:


It would be very useful, and I think very simple, to have a configurable big bold warning when a page has restricted viewing. The administrator, or space administrator, should be able to turn this feature on/off.

Use case:

    * At Atlassian, we create draft pages to document a forthcoming release. We hide them from the general public using page restrictions. But we allow Atlassian staff to see them, because they are useful in all sorts of ways. (Blitz testing, preview of forthcoming release, other people need to review new content, etc).
    * However, these hidden drafts can cause confusion because the support staff or pre-sales, or just about anyone, may not notice that the page is restricted and may give incorrect information to a customer or may send out a link which other people cannot view.
    * To prevent the above possible confusion, we add a big red note at the top of the draft page, or we add something like "(hidden draft)" in the title of the page.
    * As a result, on launch day we cannot simply remove the page restrictions via the Admin screen. Instead, we have to edit each and every single page.

If we could display an automatic warning that a page is restricted to the "Atlassian-staff" group or whatever, that would greatly improve things.

Probably there are at least some of our customers in the same boat.
fields.summary: Provide warning/info on restricted pages for easy identification

From Soren:



I use a lot of restricted pages:

    * Pages that are in draft and not ready for prime-time
    * Pages I never plan to expose because they contain sensitive information

I would like a graphical indication that a page has 'view' restrictions. Possibly a 'lock' icon in the title. I would like to be able to mouse over and get an idea of what those restrictions are. Why?

    * Because I find myself forgetting to open up pages after they're ready. I need to check for restrictions before I send a link or, if I forget, I get an email from the person saying they need to be given permission. That adds up.

    * Also, if a page has sensitive information, I find myself putting '(restricted)' in the title so that I remember that a page has sensitive information

Also, here is optimisation of something I do frequently: I find myself often emailing links to people, asking them to subscribe. I would like to have a form that pops up the email with a complete TO and CC field, where I use the user/group picker to select from users who have permission to view the page. The message body should be rendered HTML like on a page watch. Also I would also optionally like to be able to add them as page watchers.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current versions of Confluence behave as follows.

# There are two users on Confluence
 ** User A
 ** User B
 # There is the following page tree in a space
 ** Parent
 *** Child 1 (No restriction)
 *** Child 2 (Restricted to User A)
 # *User B* moves "Parent" page including the children to another space
 # As User B can see only "Parent" page and "Child 1" page, the pages are moved to the new space and "Child 2" page is left over in the old space with no parent.

User B may break the page hierarchy unintentionally in the above situation.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice if Confluence could show any notification/warning to User B in the above situation.
fields.summary: Improve notification when moving a Hierarchy including Restricted pages to a new Space

fields.description:
Hello,

the search functionality (lucene) is *really* not living up to our expectation because when the indexing language set to "GERMAN" nearly every word in the index is broken and searches do only find subsets of pages. Tests with the "luke" tool do confirm major issues. Due to this, we had to set the indexing language to "OTHER", because then confluence will not use the GermanAnalyzer() but the  SIMPLE_ANALYZER (see ConfluenceAnalyzer.java). 

Bug:
After setting the indexing language to "other" searches for words with "umlauts" (eg. Gebäude) will work when used in the left panel, but will not work when used in the dosearchsite.action result-page! The difference between these to searches is according to the HTML-Code is the *method* (GET/POST) used. 

Workaround:
We have edited the file apache-tomcat/confluence/confluence/search/searchpanel.vm and replaced the method "GET" with "POST".
This works probably because the url-encoding of the form parameters (when GET is used), seems not work correctly. I would assume
your url-encoding or url-decoding is not 8bit safe! Please check your code.

Regards
Tobias
fields.summary: Search in dosearchsite.action not 8bit safe (eg umlaut)

We export spaces to create PDF, XML and/or HTML versions of the space.

At Atlassian, we then provide these versions to the customer. In order to do this, we need to:
* Export the space.
* Save the exported file onto a local or network drive, i.e. download it from the server over the network.
* Attach the file to a Confluence page on the same Confluence site, i.e. upload the file back onto the server over the network.

fields.description:
Currently the look and feel of Confluence can be customized in three ways:

* Themes
* Layouts/Decorators
* Colour Scheme

Themes give you the power to customize Confluence completely. The same is true for layouts. But with great power comes great responsibility. You will have to know java, sitemesh or at least velocity in order to make customizations, which is not trivial and a skill most good web designers do not possess. 

On the other hand, customizing the color scheme is fairly easy, but limited to a little more then a dozen pre-defined elements on the page. You can not add additional background images, change the size or hide/move elements on the page.

The Stylesheet feature will allow for overwriting all existing styles including styles in themes. That gives you the power to customize your favorite theme without actually modifying any of it's code. The only thing you will need to know is how to write style-sheets in CSS. This opens up the styling of Confluence to many web-designers out there.
fields.summary: Custom CSS styles in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12689].
  {panel}

(This issue has been brought up several times, but I can't find a JIRA for it, so I'm creating it now)

Confluence clustering allow us to add redundancy and load balancing to our wiki service with the aims at increasing availability and scalability of the service. The problem we face is that all of this goes to waste when we need to upgrade the application, because in order to do that we need to shut down the entire cluster.

This is becoming more and more unacceptable as our user base grows because a 5-10min outage often translates to thousands of missed page views.

I understand that sometimes it is not (easily) possible to deliver this feature - mainly in cases when the new version of the application depends on a database schema, which is incompatible with the previous version.

On the other hand, changes like this don't happen very often and in many cases database schema changes often don't break the previous application (the old application just can't take advantage of the new schema features because it is not aware of them).

What I suggest is to allow cluster upgrades without the requirement to shut down the cluster whenever possible. IMO this means most of the time if the version of the application used in the cluster is not very outdated.

I realize that this will most likely require someone to watch schema changes or other changes that would make "hot" cluster upgrade impossible (incompatibilities in the serialized objects, coherence upgrades, etc), but it shouldn't be too difficult for anyone who is heavily involved in the Confluence development.

High availability is not an optional feature for Enterprise applications, so please consider this request and make necessary changes to the application as well as to the development/release processes to make Confluence more Enterprise friendly.
fields.summary: Support Confluence cluster upgrades without an outage

fields.description:
A 3rd party developer wrote a plugin for us which lacked the <plugin-info> section in the atlassian-plug.xml file.  I realize that this means it was therefore not a valid plugin, but Confluence should have recognized this and refused to enable it when it was uploaded.  It did not.  It enabled the plugin.  This caused the Plugin Repository to fail with a JavaScript error (on Firefox, it's reported as "this.installed.pluginInformation has no properties", on other platforms it manifests itself as a random null value error).   Additionally, attempting to disable the plugin via the "Plugins" console resulted in a java.lang.NullPointerException, presumably again due to the missing <plugin-info> section.

Again, I realize this was due to an incorrectly written plugin, but it would be best if Confluence could sanity-check the atlassian-plugin.xml file and refuse to enable the plugin if any essential metadata is missing.

It seems that the <plugin-info> section only needs to be present to avoid this error.  Even if the section contains no content (ie: no <version>, no <description>, no <vendor>) the repository will work as long as the section is there.  

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a plugin which has an atlassian-plugin.xml as follows:

{code}
<atlassian-plugin name="This Plugin Will Break" key="com.example.bogusPlugin">

</atlassian-plugin>
{code}

2) Create a .jar which contains this file.

3) Upload the .jar via the "Plugins" page of the admin console (not the "Plugin Repository" page)

4) Confirm that confluence installed and enabled the plugin

5) View the "Plugin Repository" page.

6) Receive the JavaScript error.
fields.summary: Installed plugins which lack a <plugin-info> tag will break the Plugin Repository

fields.description:
I've been monitoring a particular space by receiving email updates.

A common pattern is to see a burst of updates to a page, over the space of 5-10 minutes. Seems that people pretty much ignore the 'minor change' checkbox :)

It'd be great to have these aggregated into one email for a given page. Doesn't bother me if I get the email some short period after the change was made, I'd happily exchange some delay in order to get one email summarizing the changes to that page over that period, rather than get 5-7 emails with trivial changes.

Ideally I'd like to see an algorithm that works something like 'send an email summarizing the changes 5 minutes after the last change was made to the page, but never more than 30 minutes after the first change'.

It's nice to see what's going on, but it'd be nicer if it were less 'noisy' :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12663].
  {panel}

I have had a discussion with some colleagues who currently use [Twiki|http://www.twiki.org] and are evaluating Confluence.  Currently pages cannot be 'frozen' to prevent future modification.  

Scenario:  a monthly status page contains dynamically generated information from other sources.  eg a jira issue list.   After 6 months we want to see the first report, but it is executing the jiraissues list again and shows _current_ data.

I use the _jiraissues_ macro as an example, but any dynamically retrieved value (eg metadata, SQL etc) could equally be used.  I wonder how hard it would be to for example 'save' the post-rendered page content that could be retrieved and rendered 'as was' rather than 'as is'.  

Such 'frozen pages' could be available in a similar way to page revisions.

Tinylink support could could also be extended to support not only 'frozen pages' but also revisions, allowing 'permanent tinylinks to always resolve given content at a point in time.
fields.summary: Ability to freeze pages from future changes
Allow labels to be made 'recursively sticky' so pre-existing/new sub-pages include it.

fields.description:
A customer has discovered that some users are listed in the "Recent Changes" section in the Info view of a page which had no permission to edit or even view this page.

Since this Confluence installation is used in a secure environment it has caused distrust and lots of work for the root cause analysis.

To reproduce:

1. create two spaces, make one of them private.
2. In the private space, link to a page in the public page.
3. On the public page, add an attachment.
4. Whenever a new version of the same file is uploaded, the user uploading the file is listed as having modified not only the public page, but also the page in the private space linking to the public page.

With Confluence 2.5.7, deleting or adding attachments or editing the public page does not have an effect on the page in the private space. I think this is the expected behaviour.
With Confluence 2.8 it is even worse: modifying the page text, modifying or adding an attachment (but not deleting an attachment) lists the user as someone who has tampered with the private page.

I have marked this bug as critical because users may think that Confluence's permission system is broken which would be a big problem for Atlassian, at least PR-wise.
fields.summary: unprivileged users listed in "Recent Changes"

fields.description:
The list generated by the "recently-updated" macro might get quite long, too long for some places like a home page.

The blog-posts macro has a parameter to specify the maximum number of items to display, and optionally a timeframe to use (e.g., last 7 days).  Unfortunately, the recently-updated macro does not have either of this.

Please amend the recently-updated macro to allow to specify
* the maximum number of items to display
* a timeframe to use for display.

That would make the output much more and readable.

Thanks,
Torge
fields.summary: add max number of items and timeframe to recently-updated macro

fields.description:
The error in question is:
Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Not supported by BasicDataSource

Stack Trace:

Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Not supported by BasicDataSource
at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.BasicDataSource.getConnection(BasicDataSource.java:899)
at net.sf.hibernate.connection.DatasourceConnectionProvider.getConnection(DatasourceConnectionProvider.java:56)
at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.openConnection(BatcherImpl.java:292)

The probable cause is that in Tomcat 6, the supplied DBCP database pool does not support the passing of username/password credentials from the application - you have to configure them in the datasource config itself. This issue will only affect people who are using a Tomcat-configured datasource to connect to their database. People using Confluence's internal connection pooling will be fine.

I'm investigating possible workarounds now.
fields.summary: Error configuring database in Tomcat 6 when using a Tomcat-configured datasource

fields.description:
During decorator rendering, Confluence does not use a velocity context exposing the current application state with respect to spring beans or Velocity context item plugin modules.

This regression has been caused by the axing of some ostensibly redundant code from the {{ProfilingPageFilter}} and the {{ApplyDecoratorDirective}}. This code instantiates a new {{ConfluenceVelocityContext}} and copies its keys over to the context provided by the WebWork VelocityManager. This is actually necessary as the chained {{ConfluenceVelocityContext}} used by the WebWork context is instantiated once at bootstrapping and is reused for all subsequent requests. This context will never change and never see any newly enabled velocity context modules (and will never remove any disabled ones either).

The main symptom of this bug is that Velocity context item modules will not be available when Confluence is first upgraded or setup or a plugin containing such modules is installed for the first time.
fields.summary: Confluence velocity context used in decorators contains stale application and plugin state

fields.description:
If you use OS_USER then sorting in broken when viewing the people directory see screenshot. 

I suspect this is because the fullName is not available during the sort method for osuser. 


Steps to reproduce. 

1) Run confluence 2.8.1 hooking up to Mysql db. 
2) Stop confluence 
3) Import attached backup.sql via command
 mysql -u username -ppassword database_name < backup.sql
4) Change your atlassian-user.xml to use os_user
5) Run confluence and log in via admin admin 
6) Reindex
7) Go to people directory.
fields.summary: People directory sorting is broken when using OS_USER

fields.description:
Lots of error messages in the logs are showing this:

2008-07-31 19:28:06,283 WARN [TP-Processor25] [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager] getMergedContent Original version of page: page: Page title v.1 (1651212906) v.0 does not exist. Cannot merge content.

It happens when you go to the Drafts page under a user's profile in Confluence 2.9.
fields.summary: Lots of warning messages in logs: Original version of page does not exist. Cannot merge content.

fields.description:
This is a similar issue to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11534

If I deploy a new version or a new build of confluence to an app server without a restart, I always get this error:

{noformat}
WARN  2008-07-31 09:46:18,611 [service-j2ee-19] ActiveManagementCoordinator:attemptManageC3P0Registry - A C3P0Registry mbean is already registered. This probably means that an application using c3p0 was undeployed, but not all PooledDataSources were closed prior to undeployment. This may lead to resource leaks over time. Please take care to close all PooledDataSources.
erver.init.J2EERunner.confPostInit(J2EERunner.java:304)
{noformat}

This is pretty annoying on production servers, and even more annoying during development.

PS: You should create a compontent called "JMX" in this JIRA project, since a suitable place to file these reports does not exist.
fields.summary: C3P0Registry mbean is not being unregistered during shutdown

fields.description: I would like a "save as draft" option when creating/editing a page on the wiki. You should be able to at any time save a draft of a post/page that you can edit later.  You can have any number of drafts and you can save the draft on demand for a new page or an existing page (not sure how this would work if I edit a page and save as a draft and someone else edits that same page if I would have to merge or just overwrite their change).  I realize that Confluence automatically saves drafts under the Preferences -> Drafts space but its based on some timer value that individual users cannot configure (at least I haven't found out how to).  I would like to know my draft has been saved, instead of leaving my browser page open "long enough" for the auto-save to kick in.
fields.summary: Add Save As Draft button on edit/create page

fields.description:
I'm having two problems with Dynamic Task Lists.

# When opening a page with a dynamic task list on it, the page automatically jumps down to where the text box for a *New Task* is located.  I believe this is caused by the active cursor.  If the tasklist appears "above the fold", there isn't a problem, but I would appreciate the flexibility in having it anywhere on the page.  This is a problem both with FireFox and IE.
# If I make a template with both form fields and a dynamic task list, the tasklist breaks the ability to use the template.  When you click "submit variables" the page times out, and you cannot use the template.  This error only occurs with IE.
fields.summary: Dynamic Task List conflicts with form field templates and opening pages

fields.description:
Implementing feedback from [CR-874|https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/cru/CR-874]

The goal is to provide an API that can be used by clients of the HttpRetrievalService to retrieve trusted connection status and errors from a response to a trusted apps HTTP request.

This is something needed by the the JIRA issues macro (see [CONFJIRA-4|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CONFJIRA-4] for more info).
